Key Arguments: The legislation will lead to excessive censorship and legal uncertainty for online platforms.
Free exchange of ideas, even controversial ones, is essential for truth and progress.
Historical examples show that widely disbelieved ideas can later be proven true.
Centralized control over information is dangerous and should not be trusted.
Main Themes: Historical precedent of controversial ideas being validated
Distrust in centralized control of information
Notable Quotes: "I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it."

This draft bill, however, will effectively shut down the sharing of many ideas and create so much legal uncertainty for online platforms that they will be forced to censor anything which might be considered controversial.
